Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: an old catacomb ruin
An old catacomb ruin.
http://i213.photobucket.com/albums/cc100/sbguinness/passage.jpg
the low, crumbling ceiling

The low, crumbling ceiling. It is completely uneven with large chunks of stone sticking out of place here and there giving the appearance that it could topple at any moment. It is unsupported save for the bug-laced cobwebs decorating nearly every corner.
The low, crumbling ceiling. It is completely uneven with large chunks of stone sticking out of place here and there. Bug-laced cobwebs decorate nearly every corner.
the large cobwebs in the corners

{Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built upon the corners formed by the decaying catacomb walls. Some are vacant, their silken strands hanging limp in the lifeless air, others bear {unnaturally large|sinuous|hairy|chitinous} spiders huddled upon their surface, protecting a myriad of spun and captured bugs.
an over-sized cockroach

An over-sized cockroach crouched in the corner. It is three inches long and reddish-brown in color with a yellow border on its pronotum. It is fully winged, and, upon sensing your gaze, it lets out a feral hiss.
An over-sized cockroach crouched in the corner.
the northeast corner
The northeast corner formed by the decaying catacomb walls. {Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built here.
The northeast corner formed by the decaying catacomb walls. {Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built here.
the northwest corner
The northwest corner formed by the decaying catacomb walls. {Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built here.
The northwest corner formed by the decaying catacomb walls. {Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built here.
the southeast corner
The southeast corner formed by the decaying catacomb walls. {Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built here.
The southeast corner formed by the decaying catacomb walls. {Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built here.
the southwest corner
The southwest corner formed by the decaying catacomb walls. {Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built here.
The southwest corner formed by the decaying catacomb walls. {Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built here.
the corners
The corners formed by the decaying catacomb walls. {Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built here.
The corners formed by the decaying catacomb walls. {Large|Impressive|Massive} cobwebs have been built here.
a multitude of cracks
A multitude of deep cracks lace the surrounding stone structures, housing a large variety of insects and generally compromising the stability of the area.
A multitude of deep cracks lace the surrounding stone structures.
the endless dust
Endless layers of thick dust collected over time have settled on every visible surface, unhelpfully adding to the already smothering effect of the area.
Endless layers of thick dust have settled on every visible surface.
an egg {case|sack}
An egg {case|sack} has been deposited in the corner. It is {black|putrid green} in color and has been glued to its location by a thick, slimy secretion.
An egg {case|sack} has been deposited in the corner. It is {black|putrid green} in color and has been glued to its location by a thick, slimy secretion.
a {meaty|fleshy|dry|crumbling|cracked} femur bone

A whole, {meaty|fleshy|dry|crumbling|cracked} femur bone with knuckles on each end is lying on the dust-covered floor. Mounds of unidentifiable insects with prying teeth voraciously cling to its surface.
A whole, {meaty|fleshy|dry|crumbling|cracked} femur bone lying on the dust-covered floor.
the dust-covered stone floor
Beneath the thick coating of dust is a cracked, uneven stone floor. The floor appears to swell as a multitude of indiscernible, sinuous insects skitters in and out of the crevices and over your feet.
Beneath the thick coating of dust is a cracked, uneven stone floor.
some crumbling wall fragments
Separating from the decaying walls are crumbling wall fragments. Large hunks of failing, split stone teeter precariously here and there, compromising the security of the area.
Separating from the decaying walls are crumbling wall fragments.
a {degenerated|decayed|disjointed|aged|dusty|broken} jaw bone

A {degenerated|decayed|disjointed|aged|dusty|broken} jaw bone is hidden amongst the dust on the floor. Upon closer examination, you notice that both the maxilla and mandible are densely covered in bored holes, picked clean of flesh long ago. The joints have been completely severed, making it a fragile structure that could topple and break at any moment.
A {degenerated|decayed|disjointed|aged|dusty|broken}jaw bone is hidden among the dust on the floor.
a {decomposing|decayed|disjointed|aged|dusty|broken} rib cage

A {decomposing|decayed|disjointed|aged|dusty|broken} rib cage jutting out of the dust-covered floor. It appears to have seven pairs of ribs remaining, two sets having been partially eaten away. Thin strands of rotting meat dangle precariously between its spaces, providing a delectable snack for the necrophagous bugs that litter its surface.
A {decomposing|decayed|disjointed|aged|dusty|broken} rib cage jutting out of the dust-covered floor.
{atrophied|old|dusty|cracked|chipped|aged} skull

An {atrophied|old|dusty|cracked|chipped|aged} skull rests lifelessly upon the dust-covered floor. Deep, vacant eye sockets are set above a black hole where the nose once was. The mouth is frozen in a fully-open, terrified expression, as though the victim's last moments were spent screaming madly. Only a few fragments of brittle, cracked teeth remain inside, the rest gone missing.
An {atrophied|old|dusty|cracked|chipped|aged} skull rests lifelessly upon the dust-covered floor.
the spiders
Unnaturally large, hairy spiders with glowing red eyes and visible fangs tensely huddle upon the surfaces of some of the impressive cobwebs, guarding a myriad of spun and captured bugs.
Unnaturally large, hairy spiders huddle upon the surfaces of some of the impressive cobwebs, guarding a myriad of spun and captured bugs.
the decaying east wall

The east wall is comprised of a single heavy, decaying stone slab laden with cracks. An uneven layer of dust obscures the actual wall, aside from the defined hand prints scattered here and there. Although it is dark, you nevertheless note insects writhing over the surface, as well as the occasional over-sized cockroach.
The east wall is comprised of a single heavy, decaying stone slab laden with cracks. You can barely discern insect-like bodies crawling along the uneven surface.
the decaying north wall

The north wall is comprised of a single heavy, decaying stone slab laden with cracks. An uneven layer of dust obscures the actual wall, aside from the defined hand prints scattered here and there. Although it is dark, you nevertheless note insects writhing over the surface, as well as the occasional over-sized cockroach.
The north wall is comprised of a single heavy, decaying stone slab laden with cracks. You can barely discern insect-like bodies crawling along the uneven surface.
the decaying south wall

The south wall is comprised of a single heavy, decaying stone slab laden with cracks. An uneven layer of dust obscures the actual wall, aside from the defined hand prints scattered here and there. Although it is dark, you nevertheless note insects writhing over the surface, as well as the occasional over-sized cockroach.
The south wall is comprised of a single heavy, decaying stone slab laden with cracks. You can barely discern insect-like bodies crawling along the uneven surface.
the decaying west wall

The west wall is comprised of a single heavy, decaying stone slab laden with cracks. An uneven layer of dust obscures the actual wall, aside from the defined hand prints scattered here and there. Although it is dark, you nevertheless note insects writhing over the surface, as well as the occasional over-sized cockroach.
The west wall is comprised of a single heavy, decaying stone slab laden with cracks. You can barely discern insect-like bodies crawling along the uneven surface.
the decaying walls

The walls here are comprised of heavy, decaying stone slabs laden with cracks. An uneven layer of dust obscures the actual walls, aside from the defined hand prints scattered here and there. Although it is dark, you nevertheless note insects writhing over the surfaces, as well as the occasional over-sized cockroach.
The walls here are comprised of heavy, decaying stone slabs laden with cracks. You can barely discern insect-like bodies crawling along the uneven surfaces.
